metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Welcome! This page will guide you through the first steps of using GitHub for version control and collaboration.
content.html: Welcome! This page will guide you through the first steps of using GitHub for version control and collaboration.

content.text: Go to GitHub and create a free account:
content.html: Go to GitHub and create a free account:

content.text: Note: Use the same email address you plan to use for your Git configuration.
content.html: Note: Use the same email address you plan to use for your Git configuration.

content.text: After signing in, click the New button to create a new repository:
content.html: After signing in, click the New button to create a new repository:

content.text: Fill in the repository details (name, description, public/private, etc.) and click Create repository :
content.html: Fill in the repository details (name, description, public/private, etc.) and click Create repository:

content.text: A remote repository is a version of your project hosted on the internet. GitHub is a popular platform for hosting remote repositories, enabling you to collaborate with others and back up your code.
content.html: A remote repository is a version of your project hosted on the internet. GitHub is a popular platform for hosting remote repositories, enabling you to collaborate with others and back up your code.

content.text: Next, you will learn how to securely connect your computer to GitHub using SSH.
content.html: Next, you will learn how to securely connect your computer to GitHub using SSH.
